meanings.definition: To look at or watch closely or with interest.
meanings.sent1: She was eyeing the colorful flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The detective was eyeing the suspect's every move.
meanings.sent3: The cat was eyeing the fishbowl with curiosity.
meanings.sent4: The hawk was eyeing its prey from high above.
meanings.sent5: The child was eyeing the ice cream truck eagerly.

meanings.sent1: He was eyeing the menu, trying to decide what to order.
meanings.sent2: She was eyeing the job offer, weighing the pros and cons.
meanings.sent3: The student was eyeing the difficult math problem with determination.
meanings.sent4: The artist was eyeing the blank canvas, envisioning his next masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The traveler was eyeing the map, planning the route for the road trip.

meanings.definition: To have an intention or desire.
meanings.sent1: She was eyeing the last piece of cake, hoping no one else would take it.
meanings.sent2: He was eyeing the promotion, eager to advance in his career.
meanings.sent3: The dog was eyeing the bone on the table, longing to chew on it.
meanings.sent4: The child was eyeing the toy in the store, dreaming of owning it.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was eyeing the blooming roses, wishing to have them in his garden.
